newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-David Jones says ceo Tideman resigns.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-David Jones says ceo Tideman resigns.

text.p: Upmarket retailer David Jones Ltd said on Monday that chief executive officer Chris Tideman had resigned, effective immediately, citing personal reasons.
The company said Tideman, who joined in 1994, would return to Britain.
A statement on a new chief executive was expected to be made in the near future, it said.
"We would like to voice our appreciation at what he has achieved as chief executive of David Jones, particularly during the float process," chairman Dick Warburton said.
Tideman has overseen a difficult period for the Sydney-based retailer since it floated from the corporate remains of the indebted Adelaide Steamship Co Ltd group.
David Jones has consistently failed to meet its prospectus profit forecasts and its share price has been marked down sharply in the last year.
The company said in early January that it expected 1996/97 first half profit could be up to 50 percent below year ago levels, but partly qualified this pessimism later in the month.
It will release its profit result this Wednesday with Warburton scheduled to hold a news conference on the same day.
A company spokeswoman said David Jones had someone in mind to replace Tideman but would not yet reveal the name.
David Jones shares closed one cent lower at A$1.71 on Monday.
